title: llvm error checking proc-macro2 with -Zmir-opt-level=3

labels.name: A-LLVM
labels.description: Area: Code generation parts specific to LLVM. Both correctness bugs and optimization-related issues.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: requires-nightly
labels.description: This issue requires a nightly compiler in some way.

body:
repro:
````
git clone https://github.com/alexcrichton/proc-macro2
cd proc-macro2
git checkout 0ce0b3215905f18f8ecdfe6f623b35cbabde5396 
RUSTFLAGS=" -Zmir-opt-level=3" cargo check  
````
crash:
````
   Compiling proc-macro2 v1.0.6 (/tmp/proc-macro2)
conflicting debug info for argument
  call void @llvm.dbg.declare(metadata { [0 x i8]*, i64 }* %5, metadata !291, metadata !DIExpression()), !dbg !294
!289 = !DILocalVariable(name: "target", arg: 1, scope: !286, file: !5, line: 80, type: !38)
!291 = !DILocalVariable(name: "self", arg: 1, scope: !292, file: !222, line: 2873, type: !38)
conflicting debug info for argument
  call void @llvm.dbg.declare(metadata { [0 x i8]*, i64 }* %5, metadata !291, metadata !DIExpression()), !dbg !294
!289 = !DILocalVariable(name: "target", arg: 1, scope: !286, file: !5, line: 80, type: !38)
!291 = !DILocalVariable(name: "self", arg: 1, scope: !292, file: !222, line: 2873, type: !38)
LLVM ERROR: Broken module found, compilation aborted!
error: could not compile `proc-macro2`.

To learn more, run the command again with --verbose.
````

````
rustc 1.42.0-nightly (0de96d37f 2019-12-19)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 0de96d37fbcc54978458c18f5067cd9817669bc8
commit-date: 2019-12-19
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.42.0-nightly
LLVM version: 9.0
````
